intro: Cynoglossum coeruleum subsp. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf blueweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features basal leaves that are broad and heart-shaped, with a bluish-green coloration. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological restoration projects.
